page.title: 17HOUSEHOLD ELECTRICS
page.content:
Out of the twelve homes represented in our class, ten have got at least two {televison sets,}usually one large colour T.V. and a{portable monochrome for children's use. Five homes have a {video}and ten have got a{stereo unit.} Five out of the twelve children have computers at home. In the kitchen, sixty six per cent of the children's homes have{automatic washing machines, fifty per cent have{tumble driers,}but only one home has a{dishwasher. All the homes have got a{freezer, two-thirds have a{deep-fat frier,}and forty per cent have{microwave cookers.
{by Steven Bethell (age 11)
